nl.naturalis.purl.rest

Class AbstractPurlHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.purl.rest.AbstractPurlHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PurlHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MultimediaPurlHandler, SpecimenPurlHandler

    public abstract class AbstractPurlHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements PurlHandler
    Abstract base class for classes capable of handling PURL requests. Implements the one method specified by the PurlHandler interface by delegating everything to concrete subclasses via an abstract template method ( doHandle()). What it does take care of, however, is error handling. Subclasses should generally not try to handle Exceptions themselves, but just throw them out of the doHandle() method.
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Field Detail

      • MEDIA_TYPE_JSON

        protected static final java.lang.String MEDIA_TYPE_JSON
        When sending a JSON response, use this media type in stead of the prefab MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON. We seem to have reports that without the charset parameter, some browsers or browser versions don't interpret the response as expected.
        See Also:

        public final javax.ws.rs.core.Response handlePurl()
        Implements PurlHandler.handlePurl().
        Specified by:
        handlePurl in interface PurlHandler
        Returns:
        The HTTP response to be sent back to the client; most likely a temporary redirect if all goes well, or a server error if something goes wrong.

      • doHandle

        protected abstract javax.ws.rs.core.Response doHandle()
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Template method to be implemented by concrete subclasses. Subclasses are allowed and encouraged to throw any exception that should lead to a server error directly out of the doHandle method.
        Returns:
        The HTTP response to be sent back to the client.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
